comments.body:
This PR is just moving types around. The issue you're pointing out is correct, but also present in the current types

https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/adf4e18eef97454fab36830221b9b21c517af004/types/ember/index.d.ts#L365-L370

Please report this as a seperate issue here https://github.com/typed-ember/ember-cli-typescript/issues/new?template=TYPES_BUG.md&labels=%5Btypes,bug%5D&title=%5B@types/ember%20bug%5D%20-%20%3CYOUR_DESCRIPTION_HERE%3E

I'm not sure how the `@ember/*` packages should be handled. They're published to NPM (combined) as [ember-source](https://www.npmjs.com/package/ember-source), but consumed by users as individual `@ember/*` modules.

1. This is a machine-readable marker first, human-readable second, and it's *technically* true that `@ember/application` isn't on npm, so I think this should be here. Maybe I should allow an alternate wording, however.
2. What do the import statements look like? Are they literally `import { x } from '@ember/application'`?

> Are they literally `import { x } from '@ember/application'`

yes
